title: Martin Mubiru
text:
Martin Mubiru (born December 25, 1984) is a <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>, who won the bronze medal at 2006 Commonwealth Games.
In 2006 Mubiru won the bronze medal at the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202006%20Commonwealth%20Games">2006 Commonwealth Games</a> in the flyweight (51 kg.) division. In the first round, Mubiru won against Bendict Telovae from <a href="Solomon%20Islands">Solomon Islands</a>. In the quarterfinals Mubiru defeated Kenyan boxer Duncan Kuria by PTS (22:24). In the semi-finals Mubiru losing to <a href="Jackson%20Chauke">Jackson Chauke</a> from South Africa.
Professional career.
Mubiru made his professional debut in October 2006 at the Prefectural Gymnasium, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. On September 12, 2008, at the Multipurpose Centre in Kestell, Mubiru fought WBA Pan-African bantamweight title holder <a href="Bongani%20Mahlangu">Bongani Mahlangu</a>. Mahlangu dominated the fight and came away with judges scores of 118-110, 108-120 and 110-119.
